metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6822 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description: On 32-bit builds, an out of bounds write could have occurred whenprocessing an image larger than 4 GB in GMPDecodeData. It ispossible that with enough effort this could have been exploited to runarbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.7.0, FirefoxESR < 68.7, and Firefox < 75. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
